article.aside: Removed the kdata_copy() function in favour of kdata_buffer_alloc(3) and kdata_buffer_copy(3), which quickly copy only the value pairs of their sources. The reason for this removal is the addition of dependant data sources (e.g., the kdata_mean_alloc(3)), which act on structural data sources (such as buckets) that compute values based upon existing value-pairs. Also removed the kdata_array_realloc() function. For clarity, renamed kdata_hist_increment(3), kdata_bucket_increment(3), and kdata_vector_add(3) to kdata_hist_add(3), kdata_bucket_add(3), and kdata_vector_append(3), respectively.
